tool_description: Send and receive any message type to your WhatsApp, or to whatsapp groups with a shared gateway.
title: whin

api_list.name: send to groups
api_list.description: This endpoint will send a message to a whatsapp group. You need the group-id to route the message. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) lo learn how to use it.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: Enter the group identification (gid) provided by whin when you requested a group. Check the [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) to learn how to get it.

api_list.name: send
api_list.description: It will send  you a whatsapp. Learn how to use this endpoint: a text on this [video](https://youtu.be/MqAbY6Gu8yM), or this one for [media](https://youtu.be/qq3prJTVMRg) file types.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/send"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: personal listener
api_list.description:
The response is an url that you have to use as a webhook destination at the origin service. The content sent to it will be routed as a message to a whatsapp group owned by the user, or to the user.
Learn use-cases on these videos: [grafana alerts](https://youtu.be/RvVgg0qwNDk),[Shelly notifications](https://youtu.be/B6MLlBUkyvo), [synology notifications](https://youtu.be/zeAJNuXYqH4).

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: Each whatsapp group will have its own webhook address; set the group-id on this field to get a unique valid url and deliver webhooks as messages on each whatsapp group. Learn how to get a valid value [here](https://rapidapi.com/inutil-inutil-default/api/whin2/tutorials/how-to-use-the-groups-category-to-send-and-receive-whatsapps-to%2Ffrom-groups%3F-1).

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: This is the service that is sending Webhooks to your whin personal receiver. If the origin service is nos listed you can select `Do not include in request`, or leave the value blank, and whin will do its best to parse the payload received.

api_list.name: create a group
api_list.description: This API will create a group, it will add you, and will promote you to Admin of the group. Check this [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) to learn how to use it.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/creategroup"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: group invite link
api_list.description: the endpoint returns an invite link url for a group you own.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: the group id of which you want to get an invite link url

api_list.name: list groups
api_list.description: This endpoint returns a list of the groups you created through whin.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/mygroups"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: hk receiver
api_list.description: this endpoint shall be used by the origin services, it's **NOT** to be used on the playground.

api_list.name: hk receiver
api_list.description: this endpoint shall be triggered by origin services, it's **NOT** to be used on the playground.

api_list.name: hook receiver
api_list.description: This endpoint shall be triggered by the webhook origin and is not intended to be used through this frontend.

api_list.name: hook receiver
api_list.description: This endpoint shall be triggered by the webhook origin and is not intended to be used through this frontend.

api_list.name: set url
api_list.description: Set a whin-receive endpoint. Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM). This is the valid url where the whatsapps you send to whin, or are written on a whatsapp group, will be delivered. The url has to be accessible from the internet; this endpoint expects a 200 response from the destination, otherwise it wont be set.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/seturl"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: show url
api_list.description:
This endpoint is used to request the webhook routes created on your account. 
Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/showurl"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: websocket checker
api_list.description:
Whin-receive (thick-client) websockets checker. 
This endpoint is **ONLY** used to authorize websocket connections to the backend by thick clients. The Response is a token needed to complete handshaking.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/wskchk"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

api_list.name: signup
api_list.description: This endpoint is **ONLY** used to enter the code you received to signup. Follow this [video](https://youtu.be/uOZ-oH4kP58), or read the [tutorial](https://rapidapi.com/inutil-inutil-default/api/whin2/tutorials/what-to-do-to-start-using-whin%3F-1), to learn how to start using whin.

api_list.name: delete url
api_list.description: This endpoint will erase the url you set to receive the whatsapps sent to whin. Learn how to use it on this [video](https://youtu.be/8WyG_becZXM).
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://whin2.p.rapidapi.com/delurl"

headers = {
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "whin2.p.rapidapi.com"
}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

print(response.json())

parameters.name: gid
parameters.description: Enter the group identification (gid) provided by whin when you requested a group. Check the [video](https://youtu.be/wD0DWoua0L4) to learn how to get it.
